text: Nikolai Malikoff (Russian: Николай Петрович Маликов; 1874 – 20 April 1931) was a Russian-Ukrainian film director and actor who worked mainly as a film director in Russia, and later as an actor in Germany.Goble p.673 ==Selected filmography== * Insulted and Humiliated (1922) * The Island of Dreams (1925) * Superfluous People (1926) * The Son of Hannibal (1926) * His Toughest Case (1926) * Fedora (1926) * The Ones Down There (1926) * Fräulein Mama (1926) * Heads Up, Charley (1927) * The Girl from Abroad (1927) * The Trial of Donald Westhof (1927) * Apaches of Paris (1927) * Rasputin, the Holy Sinner (1928) * Spy of Madame Pompadour (1928) * The President (1928) * The Woman in the Advocate's Gown (1929) * Storm of Love (1929) * Rustle of Spring (1929) * The Ring of the Empress (1930) * Police Spy 77 (1930) == References == == Bibliography == * Goble, Alan. The Complete Index to Literary Sources in Film. Walter de Gruyter, 1999. == External links == * Category:1874 births Category:1931 deaths Category:Russian male film actors Category:Russian film directors Category:Film people from Kyiv Category:Russian male silent film actors Category:Russian expatriates in Germany
title: Nikolai Malikoff
